comments.author: ascholtz@mozilla.com
comments.creator: ascholtz@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Currently all Grafana dashboards show the following error when trying to access BigQuery datasources:

```
"BigQuery: Request is missing required authentication credential. Expected OAuth 2 access token, login cookie or other valid authentication credential. See https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/devconsole-project."
```

For example, see: https://grafana.telemetry.mozilla.org/d/XspgvdxZz/experiment-enrollment?orgId=1&var-experiment_id=bug-1638228-pref-baseline-strict-mode-by-default-retention-study-v-release-76-80&from=1590364800000&to=
comments.text:
Currently all Grafana dashboards show the following error when trying to access BigQuery datasources:

```
"BigQuery: Request is missing required authentication credential. Expected OAuth 2 access token, login cookie or other valid authentication credential. See https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/devconsole-project."
```

For example, see: https://grafana.telemetry.mozilla.org/d/XspgvdxZz/experiment-enrollment?orgId=1&var-experiment_id=bug-1638228-pref-baseline-strict-mode-by-default-retention-study-v-release-76-80&from=1590364800000&to=

comments.raw_text: We had to regenerate the creds for this. Done now and updated the Grafana config to use them.
